Articles.Content:
I searched the forum and don't see my issue.

I am using Mac - 10.10.5
Kerbal - 1.0.5
Joystick - retrolink N64

The joystick/gamepad works I used it with my old version of kerbal, which I hadn't played in a while and have been getting back into it., I also have check and the mac is recognizing the button pushes and joystick movements. The problem is when I try to set it up in kerbal nothing is reconized, no button pushes or joystick axis.

Hi Soontir_Fel, you may need to restart KSP a second time with the controller attached, as KSP needs to add it to the Settings.cfg as a known controller, then it can detect it properly on the next start.

I've restarted it multiple times with no success. The computer recognizes my controller, kerbal doesn't.

Here is the part of the KSP.log that has to do with settings:

to SETTINGS =====================
[LOG 16:01:34.354] Launcher start settings screen: False
[LOG 16:01:34.358] Joystick Names:
0: Generic USB Joystick
[WRN 16:02:09.125] [HighLogic]: =========================== Scene Change : From SETTINGS to MAINMENU =====================
I figured out what the problem was. I had USB overdrive installed. I uninstalled it and now kerbal recognizes my controller.
Okay, thanks for letting me know, now I know to tell others that USB overdrive can cause a problem.
